Hi Eric,

> By using 303 redirects and cookies=85

That's certainly an inte=
resting approach=85

> If you disable cookies, the system still works but t=
here's no override
> of conneg, so you may not get the variant you request;=
 303 makes no
> such promise, which is why I chose it.

=85and I suppose on=
e could interpret this as graceful degradation.

Also, seen the content of =
the cookie (e.g., "type=3Dxhtm; view=3Dmain") application state is also nic=
ely kept on the client side.

> I don't know the "best" way, only the way
>=
 which made sense to me and works in practice.

Thanks very much for this d=
etailed reply.

Any other opinions on this? Does anybody know of other ways=
?
Do you consider this missing inverse a hole in the spec, or can you see j=
ustifications for this?

Cheers,

Ruben
